an3.126:4.1: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans when he arrived at Kapilavatthu.
an3.126:4.4: He went up to the Buddha,
an3.126:4.5: bowed, and stood to one side.
an3.126:5.1: “Go into Kapilavatthu, Mahānāma, and check if there’s a suitable guest house where I can spend the night.”
an3.126:5.2: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He returned to Kapilavatthu and searched all over the city, but he couldn’t see a suitable guest house for the Buddha to spend the night.
an3.126:6.1: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha,
an3.126:6.3: “Sir, there’s no suitable guest house in Kapilavatthu for you to spend the night.
an3.126:6.4: But there is this Bharaṇḍu the Kālāman, who used to be the Buddha’s spiritual companion.
an3.126:6.5: Why don’t you spend the night at his hermitage?”
an3.126:6.6: “Go, Mahānāma, and set out a mat.”
an3.126:6.7: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage,
an3.126:6.8: where he set out a mat, and got foot-washing water ready. Then he went back to the Buddha
an3.126:6.10: “The mat and foot-washing water are set out.
an3.126:6.11: Please, sir, go when you’re ready.”
an3.126:7.1: Then the Buddha went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage,
an3.126:7.2: sat down on the indicated seat,
an3.126:7.5: “It’s too late to pay homage to the Buddha today.
an3.126:7.7: Tomorrow I’ll pay homage to the Buddha.” He bowed to the Buddha and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, then he left.
an3.126:8.1: Then, when the night had passed, Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha,
an3.126:8.2: and sat down to one side.
an3.126:8.4: “Mahānāma, there are these three teachers found in the world.
an3.126:8.6: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures,
an3.126:8.7: but not of sights or feelings.
an3.126:8.8: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures and sights,
an3.126:8.10: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures, sights, and feelings.
an3.126:8.11: These are the three teachers found in the world.
an3.126:8.12: Do these three teachers have the same goal or different goals?”
an3.126:9.1: When he said this, Bharaṇḍu said to Mahānāma:
an3.126:9.5: For a second time, Bharaṇḍu said:
an3.126:9.9: For a third time, Bharaṇḍu said:
an3.126:10.2: “The Buddha has contradicted me three times in front of this eminent Mahānāma.
